image.altText: Usman Khawaja is on one leg while playing a pull shot

items.synopsis: Rain ends day three early at Lord's, but not before Australia builds a 221-run lead thanks to another Usman Khawaja half-century and some ill-timed slogging from England.

title.children: English weather succeeds where English bowlers can't, halting Usman Khawaja late at Lord's

image.altText: Jim Chalmers sitting in the House of Representatives. He holds his hand over his mouth.

items.synopsis: The cost-of-living crisis cannot be resolved by one institution alone and raising interest rates isn't the only way to take money out of the economy, writes David Taylor.

title.children: The government could do more to put a lid on interest rate hikes. Here's what that would look like

image.altText: Wind turbines on a hill.

items.synopsis: Some households are facing power price hikes of up to 100 per cent as the "long tail" of last year's energy crisis hits home hard, according to consumer advocates.

title.children: Power prices to skyrocket in eastern states as energy chaos fallout hits hard

image.altText: Two men in bright yellow hazmat suits attend to a large yellow firefighting hose in a car park.

items.synopsis: The accusation came after Kyiv accused Russia earlier in June of planning a "terrorist" attack at the nuclear plant involving the release of radiation, which Moscow has denied.

title.children: Russians reducing personnel at Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant, Ukrainian intelligence says

image.altText: Commander James O'Brien pictured outside the court

items.synopsis: The coroner heard the officer had been relieved of his acting assistant commissioner duties after giving an "unfortunate interview" on ABC Radio, where he was questioned about the NT police force's response to domestic violence call-outs.

title.children: Senior NT cop 'no longer fulfilling' acting assistant commissioner role after 'unfortunate interview', DV inquest hears

image.altText: A man sitting in a vehicle wearing orange hi-vis and a white helmet

items.synopsis: Gary Henry White, 48, has admitted he married a second woman when he was still legally wed to his first wife in an extremely rare prosecution of bigamy.

title.children: 'Extremely serious in our culture': Perth man admits being married to two women

image.altText: ambulances on a tarmac next to an airplane

items.synopsis: Hawaiian Airlines flight HA451, carrying 163 passengers and 12 crew members, was approximately five hours into the voyage when it encountered strong winds.

title.children: Three passengers taken to hospital after flight from Honolulu to Sydney hit with 'severe turbulence'

mediaThumbnail.caption: WA surfer Ned Hart went viral when footage of the 16-year-old riding a spectacularly large and dangerous wave in Tasmania was posted online seconds after the ride ended. For a kid chasing the surfing dream in the digital age, the coverage could prove more valuable than a brace of sponsors ever could.

children.content: Supplied: Tim Bonython and ABC South West WA: Anthony Pancia

byLine.plain: Supplied: Tim Bonython and ABC South West WA: Anthony Pancia

document.caption: WA surfer Ned Hart went viral when footage of the 16-year-old riding a spectacularly large and dangerous wave in Tasmania was posted online seconds after the ride ended. For a kid chasing the surfing dream in the digital age, the coverage proved more valuable than a brace of sponsors ever could.
document.synopsis: WA surfer Ned Hart went viral when footage of the 16-year-old riding a spectacularly large and dangerous wave in Tasmania was posted online seconds after the ride ended. For a kid chasing the surfing dream in the digital age, the coverage proved more valuable than a brace of sponsors ever could.

synopsisAlt.lg: WA surfer Ned Hart went viral when footage of the 16-year-old riding a spectacularly large and dangerous wave in Tasmania was posted online seconds after the ride ended. For a kid chasing the surfing dream in the digital age, the coverage proved more valuable than a brace of sponsors ever could.
synopsisAlt.sm: WA surfer Ned Hart went viral when footage of the 16-year-old riding a spectacularly large and dangerous wave in Tasmania was posted online seconds after the ride ended. For a kid chasing the surfing dream in the digital age, the coverage proved more valuable than a brace of sponsors ever could.

document.title: Ned Hart nets dream wave in Tasmania

titleAlt.lg: Ned Hart nets dream wave in Tasmania
titleAlt.md: Ned Hart nets dream wave in Tasmania
titleAlt.sm: Ned Hart nets dream wave in Tasmania

items.synopsis: Ned Hart hits it big with a wild ride in Tasmania and the coverage is proving to be worth more than any contest win.

title.children: 16yo WA surfer sets internet ablaze with wild ride in Tasmania

image.altText: Head of southern righty whale emerging from water.

items.synopsis: Colleen Smetham and her husband, Paul, were on their boat when they anchored for lunch. Then they had a visitor.

title.children: Face-to-face encounter with curious whale leaves a boating couple with 'incredible' memories

image.altText: Two men in suits walk down a footpath, one in front of the other. The one in front is shielding his face with a clipboard.

items.synopsis: The ex-officer has been found guilty in Lismore District Court of knowingly having sex with a child under the age of 16.

title.children: Jury finds former NSW police officer guilty of sex with minor

image.altText: Man runs behind flaming debris in street

items.synopsis: French police clear protesters from the iconic central Paris square of Place de la Concorde after an impromptu demonstration started amid nationwide unrest following the fatal shooting of a teenager by police.

title.children: Paris streets cleared as Macron says children in riots are 'intoxicated' by video games

image.altText: Police in riot gear is pictured as fireworks are going off all around them.

items.synopsis: France entered its third night of riots after police shot dead a 17-year-old in his car. What is happening and why is it escalating?

title.children: Clashes with police, burning cars and widespread demonstrations — What is happening in France?

image.altText: Storm clouds roll over port lincoln

items.synopsis: Large parts of Australia are coming to the end of a very wet June, defying the Bureau of Meteorology's grim long-range outlook for a dry month. So what happened?

title.children: Australia's wet June washes away BOM's dry outlook. What happened?

image.altText: Gladys Berejiklian looking serious.

items.synopsis: Federal Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says Gladys Berejiklian paid a big price for choosing "a bad guy", while other supporters urge the former NSW premier to appeal Thursday's corrupt conduct findings.

title.children: Supporters urge Berejiklian to appeal ICAC findings, but experts warn it's not possible

image.altText: Spacey, wearing a blue suit and pink tie, gives a closed lipped smile

items.synopsis: The trial of Kevin Spacey for a dozen allegations of sexual assault is under way in London, during which prosecutors allege the actor "delights in making others feel powerless and uncomfortable".

title.children: Kevin Spacey described as 'sexual bully' by prosecutors as allegations aired in court

image.altText: Britain's Minister of State for Environment and International Development Zac Goldsmith walking in front of bushes.

items.synopsis: British international environment minister Zac Goldsmith resigns, saying Britain has lost its claim to a global leadership role on climate and Prime Minister Rishi Sunak was "uninterested" in environmental issues.

title.children: Boris Johnson ally quits UK government, saying Rishi Sunak is 'uninterested' in environmental issues

image.altText: A slightly blurry photo shows hundreds of people crammed onto the deck of a blue fishing boat in the ocean.

items.synopsis: Survivors of a boat disaster that likely killed hundreds of migrants near Greece recount the hellish conditions above and below deck.

title.children: Survivors of Greek migrant tragedy say coastguard rope toppled boat

image.altText: A screenshot of a woman sitting down and playing a ukulele

items.synopsis: When it comes to YouTube apology videos, Colleen Ballinger, known as Miranda Sings, did not stick to the status quo. Here's why she's at the centre of a YouTube controversy.

title.children: A YouTuber has denied child grooming allegations — in a song. Here's why she's become so controversial

image.altText: Close-up of Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif with a serious expression.

items.synopsis: The International Monetary Fund agrees to provide $4.52 billion to Pakistan — a long-awaited relief to bail out the impoverished country's ailing economy.

title.children: Pakistan clinches crucial $4.52 billion IMF bailout hours before deadline

image.altText: Bruce Bonyhady, background, looks at Bill Shorten, who is seen side-on and is speaking. Both wear black jackets.

items.synopsis: A long-running review of the NDIS has released an interim report, identifying five key areas of concern and calling on the community for more feedback.

title.children: The NDIS review has had the disability community on edge. Now we know more about it

image.altText: Stuart Broad shrugs while holding a ball during an Ashes Test against Australia.

items.synopsis: England's ultra-attacking batting costs them dearly once again, with near misses during Australia's second innings twisting the knife into Stuart Broad in particular.

title.children: Five quick hits — Stuart Broad gets in a strop after England's batters fall in a heap again

image.altText: Australia bowler Nathan Lyon arrives on crutches at Lord's before a day of play in an Ashes Test. Fans watch on.

items.synopsis: Australian off spinner Nathan Lyon faces "a period of rehabilitation" after the current Ashes Test at Lord's, with only three days between the second and third games of the series.

title.children: Nathan Lyon's calf injury 'significant', with his Ashes future in doubt

image.altText: A Sydney Swans player kicks around his body towards goal during a game.

items.synopsis: The Sydney Swans' tragic kicking for goal may finally kill off their finals hopes, as they draw with Geelong at the SCG.

title.children: No-one the winner for AFL finals as Swans, Cats draw at the SCG

image.altText: A group of rugby league players celebrate winning a match

items.synopsis: Melbourne hosting Penrith was supposed to be the match of the round but it ended with the Panthers reaffirming their place as premiership favourites.

title.children: Penrith make powerful premiership statement with Melbourne mauling

image.altText: Margot Robbie with arms out, white sunglasses, big smile with excited fans behind her.

items.synopsis: It's day two of the Australian publicity tour and Barbie stars Margot Robbie, Issa Rae, America Ferrera and director Greta Gerwig have delighted fans with an event at the Pitt Street Mall in Sydney.

title.children: 'Barbie means the whole world to me': Fans flock to Sydney's CBD to meet stars of film

image.altText: Police arrest a man sitting in the driver side of a vehicle.

items.synopsis: Two men have been charged with torture and deprivation of liberty after two people were allegedly kidnapped in the Brisbane suburb of Everton Park.

title.children: Pair escape alleged kidnapping, police arrest two men sleeping in SUV

image.altText: A woman in a white gown stands smiling holding flowers, a close up photo of a man is next in a separate photo

items.synopsis: Craig Rumsby is found guilty of murdering 17-year-old Michelle Bright at Gulgong in the Central West of New South Wales in 1999.

title.children: Michelle Bright, 17, was murdered in 1999. On Friday a jury found Craig Rumsby guilty of killing her and dumping her body

image.altText: A red sign with a skull and cross bones stands in front of a man who is picking something up from a field.

items.synopsis: Human Rights Watch says it has found new evidence of the indiscriminate use by Ukrainian forces of banned anti-personnel landmines against Russian troops.

title.children: Human Rights Watch reports new evidence of Ukrainian use of banned landmines

image.altText: A map with white dots and one prominent orange dot over Victoria's east.

items.synopsis: Yet again, Melbourne has been rocked (or slightly shaken) by an earthquake. According to Geosciences Australia, the tremor was actually an aftershock from a quake in 2021 that was centred near the tiny town of Woods Point in Victoria's High Country.

title.children: After a 'fair sort of a shake', Victorians might be wondering if they're seeing more quakes

image.altText: An array of baked good and patisserie products.

items.synopsis: Renowned South Australian baked goods manufacturer Balfours — perhaps best known for its distinctive coloured frog cakes — is changing hands, after being purchased by a WA-based pie-maker.

title.children: Frog cake maker and 'Australia's oldest bakery' bought by expanding WA pie company
